game.engine.stage.scene.object

Class SceneObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.stage.scene.object.SceneObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageSceneObject, LabelSceneObject, NinePatchImageSceneObject, SpriteSceneObject

    public abstract class SceneObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Helpful class for managing Objects in a scene. Provides methods for collision handling.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        protected abstract void paint(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
         long elapsedTime)
        Paint this SceneObject. This method maybe called for collision testing with an elapsed time of zero. For correct collision the SceneObject it is important, that the object is drawn in it's actual state.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics Object for painting
        elapsedTime - Elapsed time since the last call to this method

      • getOrigin

        public Point getOrigin()
        The origin of this SceneObject. This object's position will be translated to it's origin. The default implementation returns ORIGIN_TOP_LEFT
        Returns:
        The origin of this ScreenObject

      • isDrawBoundingBox

        public boolean isDrawBoundingBox()
        Check if the bounding box of this SceneObject is painted or not. If it is painted a rectangle will be drawn around the dimensions of this object.
        Returns:
        true if the bounding box will be painted

      • setDrawBoundingBox

        public void setDrawBoundingBox(boolean drawBoundingBox)
        Change the drawing state of the bounding box.
        Parameters:
        drawBoundingBox - true if the bounding box should be painted

      • consumes

        public boolean consumes(SceneObject obj)
        Check, if the given SceneObject is completely covered by this SceneObject.
        First test with bounding box if there maybe a overlapping situation exact calculations are made.
        Parameters:
        obj - Other Object for testing
        Returns:
        true if the given object is completely covered by this object

      • consumesExactly

        public boolean consumesExactly(SceneObject obj)
        Exactly check overlapping. Uses alpha mask to detect geometry. If there's a pixel in the given object, that has an alpha greater 0 and this object is transparent (alpha = 0) at this position false is returned.
        Parameters:
        obj - Other object for testing
        Returns:
        true if the given SceneObject is consumed by this object

      • consumesBoundingBox

        public boolean consumesBoundingBox(SceneObject obj)
        Tests overlapping with bounding box.
        Parameters:
        obj - Other Object for testing

      • collides

        public boolean collides(SceneObject obj)
        Check, if both SceneObjects collide.
        In a first step bounding box collision will be tested. If a collision maybe possible exact collision is checked.
        Parameters:
        obj - Second SceneObject
        Returns:
        true if both SceneObjects collide
        See Also:
        collidesExactly(SceneObject, Rectangle), collidesBoundingBox(SceneObject)

      • collidesExactly

        public boolean collidesExactly(SceneObject obj,
                      java.awt.Rectangle intersection)
        Check exactly if a collision is present. The result may only be correct if collidesBoundingBox(SceneObject) returns a non empty region. The default implementation tests every pixel drawn by this object. If there's a pixel set (alpha != 0) in both objects they collide. Depending on the object there maybe a better collision handling. Feel free to override this method for better performance.
        Parameters:
        obj - The second SceneObject for testing
        intersection - Region in which the collision may occur
        Returns:
        true if there's a collision

      • collidesBoundingBox

        public java.awt.Rectangle collidesBoundingBox(SceneObject obj)
        Check collision with bounding box algorithm.
        Parameters:
        obj - The second SceneObject for testing
        Returns:
        The overlapping region or null if none. Coordinates (0,0) is located in the top-left corner.

      • getRectangle

        private java.awt.Rectangle getRectangle()
        Get the Rectangle representing this object's bounds.
